abstract.text: Initiates a security context with a peer.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to the secondary status result that provides additional information in case of failure.
The credential to use when building the context. Pass
to use the default credential for the mechanism.
A pointer the function uses to return the context. Pass
for first call and use the value returned by the first call in continuation calls. Release the context’s resources using the
function when you are done with it.
The name of the target acceptor, created with
. The name must be of a type that is supported by the mechanism, as given by
The mechanism type to use. Pass
to try Kerberos (
) as a default.
Logical OR of the flags to use when building the context. See
for a list of possible values.
The time in seconds that the context should be valid. Use
to request the longest available time.
Channel bindings to use. Pass
if channel bindings are not used.
A token sent from the acceptor. On the first call, use
A pointer the function uses to return the actual mechanism used by the context. Do
not
free this object because it is held in static memory.

A buffer the function fills with an opaque token that you send to the acceptor. If the length of the buffer is non-zero, a token exists and you send it to the acceptor no matter the return status, whether complete, continue, or any error condition.
A pointer the function uses to return the actual flags supported by the context. See
for a list of possible values.
A pointer the function uses to return the actual number of seconds for which the context is valid. Pass
to ignore this output.
A status code indicating the outcome of the call. A code of
means the context is complete. A code of
indicates the need for another round of calls. Any other return code represents an error condition. See
for a complete list of possible status results.
Don’t call this function on a UI update thread because it may block on network activity.

abstract.text: Conduct secure, authenticated network transactions.
The value that indicates the maximum permitted lifetime when used in a time request.
The GSS buffer object has no value.
Indicates a
object.
A macro that indicates an empty context id object.
The value that indicates an empty credential object.
Indicates a
object.
The Kerberos Version 5 Mechanism (KRB5).
The operation completed without error.
A request for continuation during context establishment.
A 32-bit unsigned integer.
Use context services to manage secure operations between endpoints.
Evaluate return values that most GSS-API functions use to indicate the outcome of an operation.
A pointer to the OID descriptor that exchanges object identifiers with many GSS-API functions.
Accepts a security context initiated by a peer.
A pointer to a buffer descriptor that you use to exchange octet streams with many GSS-API functions.
A pointer to a channel bindings descriptor that specifies the communications channel used to carry a context.
A pointer to an opaque type that you use to exchange a credential object with GSS-API functions.
A pointer to an opaque type that you use to communicate context pointers with GSS-API functions.
Deletes a security context.
Converts a name in contiguous octet format to the internal name format.
Initiates a security context with a peer.
Returns a list of name types that a given mechanism supports.
A pointer to an opaque type that you use to communicate name objects with GSS-API functions.
Processes a token from a peer asynchronously.
Releases the memory of a credential.
Sets an option on a context.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
